title.narrative: ECCD:EDUCATION

description.narrative: Departments of Education, Community Development, Faith based organisations in six provinces have skilled staff, strategies and resources (human and financial) to implement and monitor policies and programmes relating to Early Childhood Care and Education by 2017., which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, policies and programmes to achieve inclusive universal basic education, holistic ECCD and alternative pathways to learning are in place and effectively implemented by Department of Education and Department of Community Development.

participating-org.narrative: NDOH OFFICE OF THE EXECUTIVE MANAGE PUBLIC HEALTH
UPNG SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AND HEALTH SCIENCE

sector.narrative: Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Departments of Education, Community Development, Faith based organisations in six provinces have skilled staff, strategies andresources (human and financial) to implement and monitor policies and programmes relating to Early Childhood Care and Education by2017.

description.narrative: ECD centres with multi-sector approach, modelled in three provinces in partnership with faith based organizations and CSOs. The ECD multi-sector working group established in the Autonomous Region of Bougainville (AROB), has become a model for other provinces to replicate. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2017

title.narrative: of ECCE centers established and functional (staffing, resources, students).
of staff from DoE and DfCD trained in ECCE
ECD facilitators/teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) c2a. Early learning policy and early learning programme including quality early learning curriculum and standards - score (1-4), see guidance

actual.value: 2017:Final draft for early learning curriculum and standards are in place.Pending consultation from all focal government and stakeholders. It requires NDoE to endorse ECCE Policy to be part of the Education system before Standards, Curriculum and Teacher training can be part of Education.

title.narrative: ECCE Policy developed and approved for implementation.

actual.value: 2017:ECCE policy is drafted by NDoE. Pending national consultation and endorsement.

title.narrative: ECCE curriculum developed and approved for implementation.
